repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A multi-text manuscript containing 59 works, mostly Śaiva (e.g. most of the Meykaṇṭacāttiraṅkaḷ), following each other from one page to the other or on the same page, as follows:
the Tattuvāmirtam (U3, f1r-f11v = Indien 28.1).
the Aññāṉavataipparaṇi (U3, f12r-f37v = Indien 28.2).
the Tiruvuntiyār (45 stanzas) (U3, f38r-f39r11 = Indien 28.3).
the Tirukaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār (104 stanzas) (U3, f39r11-f44v = Indien 28.4).
the Civañāṉapōtam (U3, f45r-f52r7 = Indien 28.5).
the Civappirakācam (U3, f52r7-f61r7 = Indien 28.6).
the Uṇmaineṟiviḷakkam (U3, f61r7-f61v9 = Indien 28.7).
the Irupāvirupatu (U3, f61v9-f65v5 = Indien 28.8).
the Tiruvaruṭpayaṉ (U3, f65v5-f68r6 = Indien 28.9).
the Caṅkaṟpanirākaraṇam (U3, f68r7-f80 = Indien 28.10).
the Viṉāveṇpā (U3, f81r-f81v6 = Indien 28.11).
the Neñcuviṭutūtu (U3, f81v6-f85v4 = Indien 28.12).
the Poṟṟippaḵṟoṭai (U3, f85v4-f88v5 = Indien 28.13).
the Tiruppāṇāṟṟuppaṭai (U3, f88v6-f91r = Indien 28.14).
the Pūcākāraṇam (U3, f91v-f93v = Indien 28.15).
the Tattuvaviḷakkam (U3, f94r-f98r4 = Indien 28.16).
the Uṇmaippayaṉ Akaval (U3, f98r5-f102v1 = Indien 28.17).
the Ñāṉacukātitam (U3, f102v1-f105r4 = Indien 28.18).
the Pañcākkarakkuṟaḷ (U3, f105r4-f106v = Indien 28.19).
the Ñāṉapūcai (U3, f107r-f109r4 = Indien 28.20).
the Ñāṉacāram (U3, f109r4-f117v3 = Indien 28.21).
the Tiruñāṉacākaram (U3, f113v3-f122v = Indien 28.22).
the Civañāṉacittiyār (U3, f123r-f181r = Indien 28.23): Parapakṣam (U3, f123r-f150v = Indien 28.23a) and Cupaṭcam (U3, f151r-f181r = Indien 28.23b).
the Civappirakācam (U3, f182r-f192v = Indien 28.24).
the Uṇmaiviḷakkam (U3, f193r-f196r = Indien 28.25).
poems by Cīkāḻi Ciṟṟampalanāṭikaḷ: Ciṟṟampalanāṭiveṇpā, Ciṟṟampalanāṭikalittuṟai, and Ciṟṟampalanāṭitāḻicai (U3, f196v-f205r7 = Indien 28.26).
the Mukkālattiraṅkal (U3, f205r8-f210v = Indien 28.27).
the Civāṉantamālai (411 stanzas) (U3, f211r-f236v = Indien 28.28).
the Neñcuviṭutūtu (U3, f237r-f242v = Indien 28.29).
the Pañcatikāraviḷakkam (U3, f243r-f249v = Indien 28.30).The folios 250-263 are missing in the bundle. According to the table of contents no. 2 (f[1]v, c1, 4), here was the Oḻiviloṭukkam, which is also found in U3, f300v5-f306v4 (that is, Indien 28.42).
the Tiruñāṉacākaram (U3, f264r-f269v = Indien 28.31).
the Tirukkuṟaḷ (60 stanzas selection: 1-10, 331-380) (U3, f270r-f276v = Indien 28.32).
the Ñāṉavammāṉai (U3, f227r-f278v = Indien 28.33).
the Tirukkaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār (selection of 24 stanzas) (U3, f279r-f280r = Indien 28.34).
the Civāṉantamālai (41 stanzas) (U3, f281r-f283v1 = Indien 28.35).
the Ñānamaṇamālai (U3, f283v1-f286r4 = Indien 28.36).
the Tirumantiramālai (U3, f286r4-f284v = Indien 28.37).
the Civavākkiyam (U3, f285r-f289v2 = Indien 28.38).
the Tiruvuntiyār (selection of 14 stanzas) (U3, f298v3-f299r3 = Indien 28.39).
the Civāṉantamālaiyil Aṇaintōr Taṉmai (U3, f299r3-f300v5 = Indien 28.40).According to Vinson (1868, p. 10), the text here is the same as in BnF Indien 25.13, which is the Tirukkaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār Mūlamum Uraiyum (Vinson 1868, p. 7).
the Oḻiviloṭukkam (U3, f300v5-f306v4 = Indien 28.41).
the Palavakai (U3, f306v5-f310v = Indien 28.42).
the Tirumūlar Akaval (U3, f311r-f312r6 = Indien 28.43).
the Piḷḷaiyār Akaval (U3, f312r6-f312v = Indien 28.44).
the Viṉāyakaṉ Iraṭṭai Maṇimālai (U3, f313r-f314r5 = Indien 28.45).
the Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai (U3, f314r6- f318v2 = Indien 28.46).
poems by Paṭṭiṉattuppiḷḷaiyār: Paṭṭiṉattuppiḷḷai Akaval, Neñcoṭu Makiḻtal, and Neñcoṭu Tūtu (U3, f318v3-f324v = Indien 28.47).
the Tukaḷaṟupōtam (U3, f325r-f331v = Indien 28.48).
the Ñāṉavaṇṇam (U3, f332r-f334r = Indien 28.49).
the Pūtātikaṇṭappaṟṟu (U3, f335r-f335v7 = Indien 28.50).
the Nāmanaṭṭappaṟṟu (U3, f335v7-f336v = Indien 28.51).
the Kuruvaṟiviḷakkam (U3, f337r-f340r7 = Indien 28.52).
the Aṟivāṉantappaṟṟu (U3, f340r7-f342r1 = Indien 28.53).
the Teḷivuṇmaipōtam (U3, f342r2-f343v3 = Indien 28.54).
the Coṟkeṭṭāmālai (U3, f343v4-f344v3 = Indien 28.55).
the Upatēcamālai (U3, f344v4-f347v4 = Indien 28.56).
the Tiruvaṭiviḷakkam (U3, f347v4-f351v7 = Indien 28.57).
the Cōticērviḷakkam (U3, f351v8-f353v = Indien 28.58).
the Pañcamukaccakkaram according to Vinson (1868) (U4, f1-f3 = Indien 28.59): cakkarams (cakra) and mantirams (mantra) of Īśāna, Tatpuruṣa, Aghora, Vāmadeva, and Sadyojāta. This work is not listed in any of the two table of contents.As the height of U4 exceeds by 5 mm that of U3 and as U4 is independently foliated 1-3, it appears that the manuscript is in fact a composite, which for the sake of convenience has been treated here as a multi-text manuscript.

Some works are found twice, both times complete, or one time complete and the second time as a selection:
the Tiruvuntiyār: complete in 45 stanzas (Indien 28.3) and as a selection of 14 stanzas (Indien 28.39).
the Tirukaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār: complete in 104 stanzas (Indien 28.4) and as a selection of 24 stanzas (Indien 28.34).
the Civappirakācam: complete twice (Indien 28.6 and Indien 28.24).
the Tiruñāṉacākaram: complete twice (Indien 28.22 and Indien 28.31).
According to the table of contents no. 2 (U2), the Oḻiviloṭukkam was found twice in U3, on f250-f263, now missing, and on f300-f306, that is, Indien 28.41).

There are two texts entitled Neñcuviṭutūtu: the Meykaṇṭacāttiram (Indien 28.12) and a text apparently in prose, as there is no verse numbering, which could be a prose version, a kind of commentary or a homonym work (Indien 28.29).

There are are two different texts entitled Civāṉantamālai, one in 411 stanzas (Indien 28.28), which appears to be the usual one, and another one in 41 stanzas (Indien 28.35), possibly a selection of stanzas.

Vinson (1868, p. 8) reads “வே. ௬௰,” an information that is no more found in the bundle and was possibly found on a now lost tile page folio, of the type usually found with Ariel manuscripts, providing the total and the list of works contained in the bundle. Vinson (1868, p. 11) accordingly further notes that the bundle contains 59 works, although its title indicates 60 works. This missing 60th work was presumably written on the folios 250-263 of U3, which are missing in the bundle, and was, according to the table of contents no. 2 (f[1]v, c1, 4), the Oḻiviloṭukkam.

The texts are preceded by two additional tables of contents, both incomplete and both with black pencil additions:
Table of contents n0. 1 (U1). The total stanzas are given for each mentioned text. This table stops at Indien 28.27. An addition in black pencils lists Indien 28.55 to Indien 28.58 which are missing in table of contents n0. 2
Table of contents n0. 2 (U2). The first and last foliation are given for each mentioned text. This table stops at Indien 28.54. The recto and verso are inverted in the bundle as it is.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2022).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Table of Contents no. 1 (additional). No foliation. 305 x 40 mm.
1 folio = Table of Contents n0. 2 (additional). No foliation. 305 x 40 mm.
339 folios = 58 works. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-249, 264-353. From f266, the foliation is by another hand. 305 x 45 mm.
3 folios = Pañcamukaccakkaram. Tamil foliation 1-3. 305 x 50 mm.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 28 (front cover, recto). Covering an earlier sticker.
BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 305 x 45 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson (1868) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequested in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177). Ariel manuscript not acknowledged by Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Tiruñāṉacākaram. 1952. Tiruñāṉacākaram. Ed. by Ta Ca Mīṉāṭcicuntaram Piḷḷai. Tiruvāvaṭutuṟai: Tiruvāvaṭutuṟaiyātīṉam veḷiyīṭu 56.
Ciṟṟampalanāṭikaḷ works. 1954. Cīkāḻic Ciṟṟampalanāṭikaḷ Kalittuṟai mutaliyaṉa. Ed. by Ta. Ca. Mīṉāṭcicuntaram Piḷḷai. Tiruvāvaṭutuṟai: Tiruvāvaṭutuṟaiyātīṉam veḷiyīṭu 86.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 6, no. 28.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 8r = p. 8 , no. 28.

Vinson, Julien (1868). Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 8, no. 28. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — Vinson reads: வே. ௬௰, but this information is no more found in the bundle. It is possible that it was on a title page folio, now lost, of the type usually found with Ariel manuscripts, providing the total and the list of works contained in the bundle.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
